comments: Open up a simple process in the BPEL designer. With the process editor opened, make sure that the tray which shows the variables/partner links is visible on the right side. Then begin to resize the eclipse window using the right window edge until the editor completely disappears. At this point, what happens is that the entire eclipse window looks like it had suffered a meltdown - menus are gone and views stop from refreshing - clearly some internal problem with SWT perhaps or GEF.

I think this exception summerizes the problem ...

Looks like checking for < 0 quantities fixes the problem. I am closing this bug as  it has been fixed.
